mig.core

Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • mig.core.Room

  • public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
    Room is the class representing a room, in a building for example.

    A room contains these elements :

    • A name, fixed when the room is created
    • A description, it can be changed
    • A list of exits, each exit is composed by :
      • A door : it brings to another room
      • A direction : it is where is the door in the room
      • Image : the image of the room
      • Plan Image: the image of the room in the plan

    If an exit is added to the list of exits, it has to have a direction and a door not null.

    A direction has to be validated with the class DirectionWords

    Version:
    19/11/2016
    Author:
    Group8
    See Also:
    Door, DirectionWords

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Chest chest
      Chest presents in the room It can be null if there is no chest
      private java.util.ArrayList<Item> clues
      It is the list of items present in the Room This list does not contain null value
      private java.lang.String description
      It is the description of the Room
      private DirectionWords directions
      DirectionWords to verify that the direction for an exit is good or not
      private javax.swing.ImageIcon image
      Image of the Room
      private javax.swing.ImageIcon image_plan
      Image of the room in the plan of the building
      private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Door> myExits
      It is the list of the exits enabled in the Room HashTable is used because null value is not authorized.
      private java.lang.String name
      It is the name of the Room It is set in the constructor and cannot be changed after
      private java.util.ArrayList<NPC> occupants
      It is the list of PNJ present in the Room This list does not contain null value
